required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Adrenaline for the Treatment of No-Reflow in Normotensive Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Intracoronary Adrenaline and Its Comparison With Intracoronary Adenosine in the Treatment of No-Reflow in Normotensive Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Cardiovascular Diseases, Karachi

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Cardiovascular Diseases, Karachi

brief_summary.textblock: No-reflow is defined as the lack of myocardial perfusion despite opening of the epicardial coronary vessels in the setting of percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). It has been demonstrated that either impaired flow or the absence of flow is associated with an increased rate of mortality. Among available treatment options, intracoronary adenosine is widely used in clinical practice, moreover, adrenaline is a safe alternative for the cases where use of adenosine is limited due to presence of hypotension or bradycardia. Nonetheless, evidence from retrospective and observational studies suggest that intracoronary adrenaline is well tolerated and may exert encouraging effects in prompt recovery of flow in these patients. However, very limited data are available on efficacy of intracoronary (IC) adrenaline in normotensive patients. Therefore, this study is planned to study the hypothesis that; intracoronary adrenaline is safe and has significantly higher efficacy as compared to adenosine for the treatment of no-reflow in normotensive patients with acute coronary syndrome.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Thrombolysis in Myocardial Infarction (TIMI) flow grade

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During hospital stay and at 30-day follow-up

intervention.description: Treatment group will receive adrenaline (100 to 400 mcg) for the treatment of No-reflow
Control group will receive adenosine (100 to 400 mcg)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All patients with acute coronary syndrome who developed No-reflow during PCI.
- Patients with systolic blood pressure of > 100 mmHg.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypotensive patients
- Patients with Valvular or congenital heart disease.
- Patients with Atypical chest pain
- Patients with Cardiomyopathy
- Patients with Pericarditis
- Patients with Myocarditis
- Patients refused to give consent

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: National Institute of Cardiovascular Diseases, Karachi
